channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Robinhood Touts Rock-Bottom Fees for Options Trading. Then Come the Hidden Costs.
item.description: Customers using the platform face higher transaction costs than those of other brokers, a study finds.

item.title: U.S. business activity suffers small loss of momentum in September, PMI shows
item.description: Optimism about the outlook in the year ahead deteriorated sharply to the lowest level since October 2022, in part due to uncertainty regarding the pre...

item.title: UniCredit Ups Ante in Pursuit of Germany's Commerzbank
item.description: The Italian lender moved to boost its Commerzbank stake above 20%, shrugging off German opposition to a possible takeover.

item.title: Treasury yields climb as traders ramp up ‘soft landing’ bets
item.description: Yields on long-dated Treasurys drifted higher on Monday as traders bet that the Federal Reserve would deliver the “soft landing” that investors have b...

item.title: How a Surfer Who Never Finished College Became a Biotech Billionaire
item.description: Bob Duggan’s success shows you don’t need a Ph.D., or even a college education, to make money in the complex world of biotech

item.title: J.D. Vance warns of deliberate ‘bond-market death spiral’ if Trump is elected
item.description: Sen. J.D. Vance, the Ohio Republican and the party’s vice-presidential nominee, said one of his big worries is the bond market.

item.title: Micron Needs a New Memory Boost
item.description: Worries about PC and smartphone demand have pushed down the memory-chip maker’s stock, offsetting an AI lift.

item.title: Hugo Boss shares fall on double downgrade from Bank of America
item.description: The luxury fashion brand was downgraded from a buy to an underperform rating on concerns about the ongoing slowdown in the luxury sector.

item.title: America's Ambitious Climate Plan Is Faltering
item.description: Global emissions are at records, and the shift away from fossil fuels is slowing amid high costs and surging power demand.

item.title: This chart shows gold vs. the stock market since Bernanke’s famous ‘helicopter drop’ speech
item.description: “In short, market participants seem to agree with this thesis—in a world in which the government decides to keep the economy going via heavy fiscal sp...
